Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery jar, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior (now very worn) retains traces of a self-slip and of at least three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394156) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394156)
